intro: Felicia muricata subsp. muricata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, daisy-like yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and rockeries.
